description.narrative:
Macro-economic impacts: The Project is expected to make a significant contribution to Guinea's economic growth through increased production and export of Bauxite and associated job creation and economic activity from the local supply chain. The Project will further strengthen Guinea's position as a key global supplier of bauxite for decades to come.
Fiscal impact: The Project is expected to generate significant revenue streams to the Government of Guinea (GoG). Direct contributions to the GoG will consist of royalties, local development and corporate taxes over the life of the mine.
Employment: At peak of the construction phase, the Project will employ approximately 3,500 people. During operations, GAC is expected to have 650 direct employees, of whom 520 will be local. The Project is also expected to generate significant indirect employment estimated at 9,800 jobs in the supply chain including service companies, construction, transport and maintenance operations. GAC is also establishing a skills development program for local employees which includes operational and safety training as well as leadership and language skills.
Community development and linkages program: GAC is implementing a range of social and economic development and linkages programs to stimulate economic development in the Boke region, ranging from local training and skills development, local content development, health and safety initiatives, and local infrastructure development, among others. IFC will provide ongoing advice to further enhance the impact on local community and supplier development.

The project entails the development of a 12 Mtpa greenfield bauxite mine and associated rail, port and marine infrastructure (the Project) at an approximate cost of US$1.4 billion. The associated infrastructure includes an upgrade of the existing 134 km single track mainline railway from CBGs (Compagnie des Bauxites de Guinée) operations in Sangaredi and a new port terminal at the Port of Kamsar. The Project has proven and probable reserves of 236.8 MT of bauxite with an expected life of mine of 20 years. The Project is being developed by Guinea Alumina Corporation S.A. (GAC). GAC holds a fifty-plus year mining concession which also includes the development of an alumina refinery in a second phase of the project.
